Subjective: Headaches for ~2 months; worsening in frequency (from infrequent to weekly). Location: primarily Right side, but sometimes diffuse. Character: simmers for a few days. Associated symptoms: nausea (when severe), glare in vision. Triggers: prefers dark room, worsened by talking. Meds: occasional Paracetamol, Ibuprofen (worked well). Impact: unable to play volleyball/socialize on vacation. Family Hx: Father (migraines), Grandfather (cluster headaches). Pertinent Negatives: No vomiting, no flashes of light, no known stress trigger, no family hx of tumors. Social: Occasional alcohol (2-3 beers/occasion), no smoking, no drugs. Student (medicine). ICE (Request): Wants to know if it is migraine vs. cluster headache and what to do.
Objective: BP: 120/80. Pulse: 50 bpm (regularly exercises). Neuro Exam: Cranial nerves intact. Fingertip-nose test normal. Strength in arms/legs good. Romberg's normal. Gait: slightly off on straight line walk but manageable.
Assessment: Suspected Migraine. Cluster headache less likely.
Plan: 1. Education: Read information on thuisarts.nl about migraines. 2. Medication: Start pain relief immediately at symptom onset. First-line: Paracetamol. If insufficient, add Ibuprofen. 3. Monitoring: Keep a headache diary to identify patterns/triggers. 4. Follow-up: Return in 4 weeks to review diary. 5. Safety Net: Return sooner if symptoms worsen significantly or change.
